definition: to acquire (something, such as land) by preemption
to seize upon to the exclusion of others : take for oneself
examples: the movement was then preempted by a lunatic fringe

definition: to replace with something considered to be of greater value or priority : take precedence over
examples: the program did not appear, having been preempted by a baseball game

definition: to replace or supersede (a law) or bar (an action) by the doctrine of preemption
examples: In so doing, the Court held that Congress did not intend to preempt common law contract claims.
— Charas v. Trans World Airlines, Inc.

definition: to gain a commanding or preeminent place in
to prevent from happening or taking place : forestall, preclude
to make a preemptive bid in bridge
